meanings.definition: Cause or allow (liquid) to flow over the edge of its container.
meanings.sent1: Be careful not to spills the milk when pouring it into the glass.
meanings.sent2: The water spills out of the cup when it is too full.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter spills the soup on the customer's lap.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spills out of her like a bubbling fountain.
meanings.sent5: The excitement spills over as she jumps up and down.

meanings.definition: An instance of liquid flowing over the edge of its container.
meanings.sent1: The spills on the table needed to be cleaned up quickly.
meanings.sent2: She wiped the spills of juice off the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent3: The spills from the overturned glass formed a small puddle on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The spills of paint on the canvas created a beautiful abstract pattern.
meanings.sent5: The spills of water shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The hiker had a few spills on the rocky trail.
meanings.sent2: After the spills down the stairs, she decided to be more careful.
meanings.sent3: The spills during the race made the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: His spills on the ice rink were graceful and controlled.
meanings.sent5: The spills of leaves in the autumn wind were like a dance.
